intro: Jungia, commonly known as the "scented leaf plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plants are characterized by their aromatic leaves, which are often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb. Jungia species typically have small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. They thrive in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
